tasks.title: Use Alde heating on gas only

images.alt: Alde control panel showing gas mode
images.caption: Select gas-only mode on Alde panel

images.alt: Gas bottle valve in open position
images.caption: Ensure gas bottle valve is open

steps: Check gas bottle is not empty and valve is open in gas locker
On the Alde control panel, select 'Gas Only' mode
Set your desired temperature using the controls
Wait for the burner to ignite - listen for the click and fan
Allow 15-30 minutes for vehicle to warm up
Adjust temperature as needed once warm
safety_warnings: Never run gas heating while refuelling at petrol stations
Ensure adequate ventilation
If you smell gas, turn off immediately and ventilate
Do not block radiator convectors

tasks.title: Use Alde heating on electric (mains)

images.caption: Select electric mode on Alde panel

steps: Connect to mains hook-up (vehicle inlet first, then bollard)
On Alde panel, select 'Electric Only' or 'Electric + Gas' mode
Set temperature using controls
System will heat using immersion elements
Electric heating is quieter but may take longer to heat up
safety_warnings: Ensure mains connection is secure and dry
Use only on campsites with adequate electrical supply

tasks.title: Switch fridge to 12V while driving
steps: Before starting your journey, locate the fridge control panel
Switch from 'Gas' or '230V' to '12V' mode
If fridge has 'Auto' mode, this may handle switching automatically
Verify the 12V indicator light is on
The fridge will run from the vehicle alternator while driving
safety_warnings: Never leave gas running while driving
Turn off gas supply before entering petrol stations
12V mode only works when engine is running

tasks.title: Run fridge on gas off-grid

images.alt: Fridge control panel showing gas mode
images.caption: Select gas mode for off-grid operation

steps: Ensure gas bottle valve is open in gas locker
Switch fridge to 'Gas' mode on the control panel
Check the gas flame indicator shows ignition
Level the vehicle as much as possible for efficient operation
Set temperature as needed
safety_warnings: Ensure external vents are not blocked
Switch to 12V before driving
Level vehicle within 3 degrees for efficiency

tasks.title: Deploy rear electric drop-down bed

images.caption: Start position: bed raised and secure

steps: Clear the rear lounge area of any obstructions
Ensure no one is standing or sitting beneath the bed
Locate the bed control switch on the wall
Press and hold the 'DOWN' button
Guide the bed down smoothly if needed
Release when bed reaches desired height
Check bed is stable and level before use
safety_warnings: NEVER lower bed while driving
Keep fingers clear of mechanism during operation
Do not exceed bed weight limit
Ensure bed is fully raised before driving

tasks.title: Deploy pull-down bed over half dinette
steps: Clear the dinette area below
Locate the release latch on the bed frame
Release the latch carefully
Lower the bed gently using the support straps
Ensure support legs or straps are engaged
Check bed is stable before use
safety_warnings: Ensure bed is securely latched before driving
Check support straps are in good condition
Do not exceed weight limit

tasks.title: Use 360° camera for manoeuvring

images.caption: Bird's eye view on dashboard display

steps: Switch on ignition
Press the 360° camera button (or it may activate automatically at low speed)
View the bird's eye display on the dashboard monitor
Use to check clearances on all sides
Switch between views if available (front, sides, rear)
Always perform visual checks as well as using the camera
safety_warnings: Do not rely solely on cameras
Always check mirrors and perform visual observation
Camera may have limited visibility in poor light
Keep camera lenses clean

tasks.title: Use reversing camera when parking
steps: Before reversing, check mirrors and perform visual check around vehicle
Select reverse gear
Camera activates automatically and displays on dashboard
Use the parking guidelines to judge distance
Proceed slowly while watching screen AND checking mirrors
Be aware of any blind spots
safety_warnings: Check for children, pets, and low obstacles before reversing
Use mirrors and direct checks in addition to camera
Keep rear camera lens clean

tasks.title: Set up front cab TV for viewing
steps: Ensure vehicle is parked and handbrake is on
Swivel the TV bracket to face the cab seats
Extend the TV aerial for best reception
Switch on TV using remote or button
Select input source (Freeview, DVD, etc.)
Tune channels if first time use
safety_warnings: Never watch TV while driving
Secure TV in stowed position before driving
Monitor battery if using on 12V

tasks.title: Set up rear lounge TV
steps: Position yourself comfortably in the rear lounge or bed
Adjust TV bracket angle if needed
Extend the TV aerial
Switch on TV using remote
Select desired input or channel
safety_warnings: Secure TV before driving
Do not block ventilation around TV
Monitor battery when using on 12V without mains

tasks.title: Connect outdoor BBQ safely

images.caption: External BBQ gas point behind panel

steps: Open the external BBQ point cover
Check the gas point valve is closed
Connect your BBQ hose to the quick-release fitting
Check connection is secure
Open the main gas bottle valve in the gas locker
Open the BBQ point valve
Light your BBQ following its instructions
When finished, close BBQ point valve first, then main gas
safety_warnings: Close BBQ point valve when not in use
Check connections for leaks using soapy water
Use only in well-ventilated outdoor areas
Never use BBQ indoors or in enclosed spaces

tasks.title: Extend the awning
steps: Ensure vehicle is parked on level ground
Release the awning lock mechanism
Insert the winding handle into the mechanism
Turn handle to extend awning fabric
Pull down support legs when extended
Adjust leg height for desired angle
Secure legs with pegs in windy conditions
Adjust guy ropes if fitted
safety_warnings: Never drive with awning extended
Retract awning in strong winds (over 20mph)
Do not allow water to pool on fabric
Secure legs with pegs or weights

tasks.title: Use the outdoor shower
steps: Open the external shower compartment
Connect the shower head to the fitting if not attached
Turn on the water pump inside the vehicle
Test water temperature before use - hot water may be very hot
Use shower as needed
When finished, turn off water at the shower
Turn off water pump if not needed
Allow hose to drain and store securely
safety_warnings: Check water temperature before use
Grey water drains to ground - use in appropriate locations
Monitor water tank level during extended use

tasks.title: Set up outdoor TV point
steps: Set up a stable table or TV stand under the awning
Open the external TV point cover
Connect TV power lead to 12V socket
Connect aerial cable if available
Position TV securely on stand
Power on and tune as needed
safety_warnings: Protect TV from rain and moisture
Do not leave TV outside unattended
Secure cables to prevent trip hazards

tasks.title: Change a gas bottle
steps: Turn off all gas appliances (heating, hob, fridge)
Close the valve on the empty bottle
Disconnect the pigtail hose from the empty bottle
Remove the empty bottle from the locker
Place the new full bottle in position securely
Connect the pigtail hose to the new bottle
Slowly open the new bottle valve
Check connections for leaks using soapy water
If using changeover valve, switch to new bottle
safety_warnings: No smoking or flames near gas locker
Check connections for leaks using soapy water
Ensure locker drain hole is clear
Store empty bottles upright

tasks.title: Empty the toilet cassette

images.caption: Open external door for cassette access

steps: Locate a chemical toilet disposal point (Elsan point)
Open the external cassette access door
Release the cassette locking mechanism
Carefully slide the cassette out
Keep cassette upright and carry to disposal point
Open the pour spout and empty into drain
Rinse cassette with clean water
Return cassette to vehicle and lock in place
Add fresh toilet chemical as per product instructions
safety_warnings: Only empty at designated disposal points
Wear gloves when handling cassette
Keep cassette blade closed when transporting
Rinse cassette after emptying

tasks.title: Fill the fresh water tank
steps: Locate the fresh water filler cap on the exterior
Remove the cap
Connect your drinking water hose
Turn on water supply slowly
Monitor tank level on control panel inside
Stop when tank shows full
Replace and secure filler cap
safety_warnings: Use only drinking water approved hoses
Do not overfill
Flush system if water has been standing

tasks.title: Arm the alarm system
steps: Close all doors and windows
Close all roof vents
Exit the vehicle and close habitation door
Press the lock/arm button on your key fob
Wait for confirmation beep or light flash
Verify alarm indicator shows armed status
safety_warnings: Ensure windows are closed to prevent false alarms
Know how to disarm quickly to silence false alarms
Keep spare fob battery available

tasks.title: Check vehicle location via tracker
steps: Open the tracker app on your smartphone
Log in with your credentials
View the current location of your vehicle
Check last update time to ensure data is recent
Use map view to see surroundings
safety_warnings: Keep tracker subscription active
Report theft to police AND tracker company immediately
Test tracker periodically to ensure it's working

tasks.title: Connect to 5G WiFi hotspot
steps: Ensure the 5G router is powered on
On your device, open WiFi settings
Find the motorhome WiFi network name
Enter the WiFi password
Wait for connection
Check signal strength - may need to relocate to improve signal
safety_warnings: Check data allowance to avoid excess charges
Router draws power from leisure battery
Secure network with strong password

tasks.title: Install front heat shield
steps: Unfold the heat shield
Position silver reflective side facing outward
Attach to windscreen using suction cups or magnets
Wrap side panels around wing mirrors
Secure straps or ties underneath vehicle or to door handles
Check all edges are secured
safety_warnings: Remove COMPLETELY before driving
Store securely when not in use
Check straps and fixings regularly

tasks.title: Use blinds and flyscreens
steps: To deploy blind: Pull down from cassette housing and click into place
To deploy flyscreen: Pull down/across separately from the blind
Use flyscreen alone for ventilation while keeping insects out
Use blind for privacy or blackout
To retract: Release clip and allow to roll up gently
For roof skylights: Use the integrated blind handle
safety_warnings: Close blinds and skylights before driving
Do not force mechanisms
Handle flyscreen mesh gently

tasks.title: Check solar charging status
steps: Locate the solar charge controller (often near main panel)
Check display for current charging status
Look for amperage output - higher = more charging
Check leisure battery level on main control panel
If not charging well, check panels are clean and in direct sunlight
safety_warnings: Do not walk on solar panels
Keep panels clean for best efficiency
Solar charges automatically - no action needed

tasks.title: Connect to mains hook-up
steps: Fully uncoil mains cable (never use coiled)
Connect cable to VEHICLE inlet first
Then connect to campsite bollard
Switch on at bollard
Check control panel shows mains connected
Battery charger will start automatically
safety_warnings: Always connect to vehicle FIRST, then mains
When disconnecting, disconnect mains FIRST
Never use damaged or wet cables

tasks.title: Prepare the vehicle for driving

images.caption: Ensure all beds are raised and secured

steps: Raise and secure ALL drop-down and pull-down beds
Secure all loose items and close all cupboards
Switch fridge to 12V or off
Close and lock all roof vents and windows
Retract the step
Disconnect and stow mains cable
Turn off gas at bottle
Remove and stow heat shield completely
Retract awning if extended
Check all exterior lockers are locked
Lower TV aerial if raised
Check tyre pressures and lights
Adjust mirrors and test cameras
safety_warnings: NEVER drive with drop-down bed lowered
NEVER drive with awning extended
All passengers must use seatbelts
Check route for height restrictions

tasks.title: Troubleshoot: No water from taps

images.caption: Check water level on control panel

steps: Check water tank level on control panel - refill if empty
Verify water pump is switched on at control panel
Check pump fuse in fuse box
Listen for pump when opening a tap
If pump runs but no water, check for airlocks
Check water filter if fitted
In cold weather, check for frozen pipes
safety_warnings: Do not run pump dry for extended periods
If you smell burning, turn off immediately

tasks.title: Troubleshoot: Alde heating not working
steps: Check gas bottle is not empty and valve is open
Check Alde panel for error codes
Ensure mains is connected if using electric mode
Check fuses related to Alde system
Try turning system off and on again
Check glycol fluid level when system is cold
If error codes persist, consult Alde manual or dealer
safety_warnings: If you smell gas, turn off immediately and ventilate
Do not attempt to repair gas components yourself
Contact qualified Alde technician for persistent issues

tasks.title: Troubleshoot: 12V electrical fault
steps: Check main battery disconnect switch is on
Verify battery level on control panel
Check fuse box for blown fuses
If on mains, check charger is working
Check battery terminals are clean and tight
Test individual circuits to isolate problem
safety_warnings: Replace fuses with correct amp rating only
Disconnect battery before working on electrics
Do not attempt major electrical repairs
